config.text: You're about to drive home. What should you do if you feel very tired and have a severe headache?

choices.label: Wait until you're fit and well before driving
Drive home, but take a tablet for headaches
Drive home if you can stay awake for the journey
Wait for a short time, then drive home slowly

correct.text: All of your concentration should be on your driving. Any pain you feel will distract you, and you should avoid driving when drowsy. The safest course of action is to wait until you've rested and are feeling better before starting your journey.

incorrect.text: All of your concentration should be on your driving. Any pain you feel will distract you, and you should avoid driving when drowsy. The safest course of action is to wait until you've rested and are feeling better before starting your journey.

meta.xref: DES s6, DES s10, KYTS p26

config.text: Which type of vehicle should you be ready to give way to as you approach this bridge?

choices.label: Bicycles
Buses
Motorcycles
Cars

correct.text: A bus or high-sided lorry will have to take a position in the centre of the road to clear the bridge. There's normally a sign to show this. Look well ahead, past the bridge and be ready to stop and give way to large oncoming vehicles.

incorrect.text: A bus or high-sided lorry will have to take a position in the centre of the road to clear the bridge. There's normally a sign to show this. Look well ahead, past the bridge and be ready to stop and give way to large oncoming vehicles.

config.text: Why should you be cautious when going past this bus waiting at a bus stop?

choices.label: There's a zebra crossing ahead
There are driveways on the left
People may cross the road in front of it
The road surface will be slippery

correct.text: A bus at a bus stop can hide pedestrians who might try to cross the road just in front of it. Drive at a speed that will enable you to respond safely if you have to.

incorrect.text: A bus at a bus stop can hide pedestrians who might try to cross the road just in front of it. Drive at a speed that will enable you to respond safely if you have to.

meta.xref: DES s1, HC r91, HC r95-96, HC r148

config.text: What can seriously reduce your ability to concentrate?

choices.label: Drugs
Busy roads
Tinted windows
Weather conditions

correct.text: Both recreational drugs and prescribed medicine can affect your concentration. It's also an offence to drive with certain drugs in your body and a positive test could lead to a conviction.

incorrect.text: Both recreational drugs and prescribed medicine can affect your concentration. It's also an offence to drive with certain drugs in your body and a positive test could lead to a conviction.

config.text: What will be a serious distraction while you're driving?

choices.label: Looking at road maps
Switching on your demister
Using your windscreen washers
Looking in your door mirror

correct.text: Looking at road maps while driving is very dangerous. If you aren’t sure of your route, stop in a safe place and check the map. You must not allow anything to take your attention away from the road while you’re driving.

incorrect.text: Looking at road maps while driving is very dangerous. If you aren’t sure of your route, stop in a safe place and check the map. You must not allow anything to take your attention away from the road while you’re driving.

meta.xref: DES s6, DES s10, HC r291

config.text: Why should you slow down as you approach this hazard?

choices.label: Because of the level crossing
Because it’s hard to see to the right
Because of approaching traffic
Because of animals crossing

correct.text: You should be slowing down and selecting the correct gear in case you have to stop at the level crossing. Look for the signals and be prepared to stop if necessary.

incorrect.text: You should be slowing down and selecting the correct gear in case you have to stop at the level crossing. Look for the signals and be prepared to stop if necessary.

meta.xref: DES s6, DES s10, KYTS p26

config.text: What type of vehicle could you expect to meet in the middle of the road?

choices.label: Lorry
Bicycle
Car
Motorcycle

correct.text: The highest point of the bridge is in the centre, so a large vehicle might have to move to the centre of the road to have enough room to pass safely under the bridge.

incorrect.text: The highest point of the bridge is in the centre, so a large vehicle might have to move to the centre of the road to have enough room to pass safely under the bridge.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p129, KYTS p11

config.text: What should you expect if you see this sign ahead?

choices.label: The road will go steeply uphill
The road will go steeply downhill
The road will bend sharply to the left
The road will bend sharply to the right

correct.text: This sign indicates that the road will bend sharply to the left. Slow down in plenty of time and select the correct gear before you start to turn. Braking hard and late, while also sharply changing direction, is likely to cause a skid.

incorrect.text: This sign indicates that the road will bend sharply to the left. Slow down in plenty of time and select the correct gear before you start to turn. Braking hard and late, while also sharply changing direction, is likely to cause a skid.

config.text: Why should you make allowances for older drivers?

choices.label: Older drivers are exempt from wearing seat belts
Older drivers can only drive cars that have automatic gearboxes
Older drivers' reactions may be slower than other drivers
Older drivers take more risks than other drivers

correct.text: As people age, their reaction time gets slower. The rate of decline varies from person to person but you can expect them to take longer to react to a hazard and they may be hesitant in some situations – for example, at a junction.

incorrect.text: As people age, their reaction time gets slower. The rate of decline varies from person to person but you can expect them to take longer to react to a hazard and they may be hesitant in some situations – for example, at a junction.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r293, KYTS p30

config.text: You're driving towards this level crossing. What would be the first warning of an approaching train?

choices.label: Both half-barriers down
A steady amber light
One half-barrier down
Twin flashing red lights

correct.text: The steady amber light will be followed by twin flashing red lights that mean you must stop. An alarm will also sound to alert you to the fact that a train is approaching.

incorrect.text: The steady amber light will be followed by twin flashing red lights that mean you must stop. An alarm will also sound to alert you to the fact that a train is approaching.

meta.xref: DES s1, HC r90, HC r92

config.text: What must you do if your eyesight has become very poor and you're no longer able to meet the driver's eyesight requirements?

choices.label: Tell the driver licensing authority
Tell your doctor
Tell the police
Tell your optician

correct.text: Having very poor eyesight will have a serious effect on your ability to drive safely. If you can't meet the driver's eyesight requirements, you must tell DVLA (or DVA in Northern Ireland).

incorrect.text: Having very poor eyesight will have a serious effect on your ability to drive safely. If you can't meet the driver's eyesight requirements, you must tell DVLA (or DVA in Northern Ireland).

config.text: What should you do if a doctor prescribes drugs that are likely to affect your driving?

choices.label: Only drive if someone is with you
Avoid driving on motorways
Get someone else to drive
Never drive at more than 30 mph

correct.text: You shouldn't drive if you're taking medicine that could cause you to feel drowsy at the wheel. Ask someone else to drive or, if that isn't possible, find another way to get home.

incorrect.text: You shouldn't drive if you're taking medicine that could cause you to feel drowsy at the wheel. Ask someone else to drive or, if that isn't possible, find another way to get home.

config.text: You're invited to a pub lunch. What should you do if you know that you'll have to drive in the evening?

choices.label: Avoid mixing your alcoholic drinks
Don't drink any alcohol at all
Have some milk before drinking alcohol
Eat a hot meal with your alcoholic drinks

correct.text: Alcohol will stay in your body for several hours and may make you unfit to drive later in the day. Drinking during the day will also affect your performance at work or study.

incorrect.text: Alcohol will stay in your body for several hours and may make you unfit to drive later in the day. Drinking during the day will also affect your performance at work or study.

config.text: A driver’s behaviour has upset you. How can you get over this incident safely?

choices.label: Stop and take a break
Shout abusive language
Gesture to them with your hand
Follow them, flashing your headlights

correct.text: If you feel yourself becoming tense or upset, stop in a safe place and take a break. Tiredness can make things worse and may cause a different reaction to upsetting situations.

incorrect.text: If you feel yourself becoming tense or upset, stop in a safe place and take a break. Tiredness can make things worse and may cause a different reaction to upsetting situations.

meta.xref: DES s1, DES s11, HC r91

config.text: Do you need to plan rest stops when you’re planning a long journey?

choices.label: Yes, you should plan to stop every half an hour
Yes, regular stops help concentration
No, you’ll be less tired if you get there as soon as possible
No, only fuel stops will be needed

correct.text: Try to plan your journey so that you can take rest stops. It’s recommended that you take a break of at least 15 minutes after every two hours of driving or riding. This should help to maintain your concentration.

incorrect.text: Try to plan your journey so that you can take rest stops. It’s recommended that you take a break of at least 15 minutes after every two hours of driving or riding. This should help to maintain your concentration.

config.text: What hazard should you be aware of when travelling along this street?

choices.label: Glare from the sun
Lack of road markings
Children running out between vehicles
Large goods vehicles

correct.text: On roads where there are many parked vehicles, you might not be able to see children between parked cars and they may run out into the road without looking.

incorrect.text: On roads where there are many parked vehicles, you might not be able to see children between parked cars and they may run out into the road without looking.

config.text: What advice should you give to a driver who has had a few alcoholic drinks at a party?

choices.label: Have a strong cup of coffee and then drive home
Drive home carefully and slowly
Go home by public transport
Wait a short while and then drive home

correct.text:
Drinking black coffee or waiting a few hours won't make any difference. Alcohol takes time to leave the body.
A driver who has been drinking should go home by public transport or taxi. They might even be unfit to drive the following morning.

incorrect.text:
Drinking black coffee or waiting a few hours won't make any difference. Alcohol takes time to leave the body.
A driver who has been drinking should go home by public transport or taxi. They might even be unfit to drive the following morning.

config.text: You're driving a car fitted with automatic transmission. When would you use 'kick-down'?

choices.label: To engage cruise control
To accelerate quickly
To brake progressively
To improve fuel economy

correct.text: 'Kick-down' selects a lower gear, enabling the vehicle to accelerate faster.

incorrect.text: 'Kick-down' selects a lower gear, enabling the vehicle to accelerate faster.

meta.xref: DES s8, DES s10, HC r171, KYTS p16

config.text: What must you do at this junction?

choices.label: Stop behind the line, then edge forward to see clearly
Stop beyond the line, at a point where you can see clearly
Stop only if there's traffic on the main road
Stop only if you're turning right

correct.text: The ‘stop’ sign has been put here because the view into the main road is poor. You must stop because it won't be possible to take proper observation while you're moving.

incorrect.text: The ‘stop’ sign has been put here because the view into the main road is poor. You must stop because it won't be possible to take proper observation while you're moving.

config.text: You're waiting to emerge at a junction. Your view is restricted by parked vehicles. What can help you to see traffic on the road you're joining?

choices.label: Looking for traffic behind you
Reflections of traffic in windows
Making eye contact with other road users
Checking for traffic in your interior mirror

correct.text: You must be completely sure it's safe to emerge. Try to look for traffic through the windows of the parked cars or in the reflections in windows. Keep looking in all directions as you slowly edge forwards until you can see it's safe.

incorrect.text: You must be completely sure it's safe to emerge. Try to look for traffic through the windows of the parked cars or in the reflections in windows. Keep looking in all directions as you slowly edge forwards until you can see it's safe.

config.text: Why should the junction on the left be kept clear?

choices.label: To allow vehicles to enter and emerge
To allow the bus to reverse
To allow vehicles to make a U-turn
To allow vehicles to park

correct.text: You should always try to keep junctions clear. If you're in queuing traffic, make sure that when you stop you leave enough space for traffic to flow in and out of the junction.

incorrect.text: You should always try to keep junctions clear. If you're in queuing traffic, make sure that when you stop you leave enough space for traffic to flow in and out of the junction.

config.text: What type of vehicle uses an amber flashing beacon on a dual carriageway?

choices.label: An ambulance
A fire engine
A doctor on call
A tractor

correct.text: An amber flashing beacon on a vehicle indicates that it's moving slowly or stopped and a possible hazard. Look well ahead on a dual carriageway and you should be able to see and respond to these vehicles in good time.

incorrect.text: An amber flashing beacon on a vehicle indicates that it's moving slowly or stopped and a possible hazard. Look well ahead on a dual carriageway and you should be able to see and respond to these vehicles in good time.

config.text: You're about to drive your car. What should you do if you can't find the glasses you need to wear?

choices.label: Drive home slowly, keeping to quiet roads
Borrow a friend’s glasses and use those
Drive home at night, so that the lights will help you
Find a way of getting home without driving

correct.text: If you need to wear glasses for driving, it's illegal to drive without them. You must be able to see clearly when you're driving.

incorrect.text: If you need to wear glasses for driving, it's illegal to drive without them. You must be able to see clearly when you're driving.

config.text: You intend to turn left at the traffic lights. What should you do just before turning?

choices.label: Check your right mirror
Move up closer to the car ahead
Move out to the right
Check for bicycles on your left

correct.text: If you've been in a queue of traffic and are about to turn left, check your nearside for cyclists as they often filter past on the nearside of slow-moving or stationary vehicles.

incorrect.text: If you've been in a queue of traffic and are about to turn left, check your nearside for cyclists as they often filter past on the nearside of slow-moving or stationary vehicles.

config.text: Why are place names painted on the road surface?

choices.label: To restrict the flow of traffic
To warn of oncoming traffic
To help you select the correct lane in good time
To prevent you from changing lanes

correct.text: The names of towns and cities may be painted on the road at busy junctions and complex road systems. They guide you into the correct lane in good time, allowing traffic to flow more freely.

incorrect.text: The names of towns and cities may be painted on the road at busy junctions and complex road systems. They guide you into the correct lane in good time, allowing traffic to flow more freely.

meta.xref: DES s1, HC r90, HC r96

config.text: Why should you check the information leaflet before taking any medicine?

choices.label: Drug companies want customer feedback on their products
You may have to let your insurance company know about the medicine
Some types of medicine can affect your ability to drive safely
The medicine you take may affect your hearing

correct.text: Always check the label or information leaflet for any medication you take. The medicine might affect your driving. If you aren’t sure, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

incorrect.text: Always check the label or information leaflet for any medication you take. The medicine might affect your driving. If you aren’t sure, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

config.text: What should the driver of the red car (arrowed) do?

choices.label: Wave towards the pedestrians who are waiting to cross
Wait for the pedestrian in the road to cross
Quickly drive behind the pedestrian in the road
Tell the pedestrian in the road she shouldn't have crossed

correct.text: Some people might take a long time to cross the road. They may be older or have a disability. Be patient and don't hurry them by showing your impatience. If pedestrians are standing at the side of the road, don't signal or wave them to cross. Other road users might not have seen your signal and this could lead the pedestrians into a hazardous situation.

incorrect.text: Some people might take a long time to cross the road. They may be older or have a disability. Be patient and don't hurry them by showing your impatience. If pedestrians are standing at the side of the road, don't signal or wave them to cross. Other road users might not have seen your signal and this could lead the pedestrians into a hazardous situation.

meta.xref: DES s7, DES s12, HC r126, HC r227

config.text: What should you do if it's raining and you're following this lorry on a motorway?

choices.label: Allow a two-second separation gap
Switch your headlights onto main beam
Move into a lane that has less spray
Be aware of spray reducing your vision

correct.text:
The usual two-second time gap increases to four seconds when the roads are wet. If you stay well back, you’ll
  • be able to see past the vehicle
  • be out of the spray thrown up by the lorry’s tyres
  • give yourself more time to stop if the need arises
  • increase your chances of being seen by the lorry driver.

incorrect.text:
The usual two-second time gap increases to four seconds when the roads are wet. If you stay well back, you’ll
  • be able to see past the vehicle
  • be out of the spray thrown up by the lorry’s tyres
  • give yourself more time to stop if the need arises
  • increase your chances of being seen by the lorry driver.

config.text: You're driving towards this left-hand bend. What danger should you be anticipating?

choices.label: A vehicle overtaking you
Mud on the road
The road getting narrower
Pedestrians walking towards you

correct.text: Pedestrians walking on a road with no pavement should walk against the direction of the traffic. You can’t see around this bend and if pedestrians are in the road you need to be able to deal with the situation safely. Always keep this in mind and give yourself time to react if a hazard does appear.

incorrect.text: Pedestrians walking on a road with no pavement should walk against the direction of the traffic. You can’t see around this bend and if pedestrians are in the road you need to be able to deal with the situation safely. Always keep this in mind and give yourself time to react if a hazard does appear.

config.text: Some two-way roads are divided into three lanes. Why are they particularly dangerous?

choices.label: Traffic in both directions can use the middle lane to overtake
Traffic can travel faster in poor weather conditions
Traffic can overtake on the left
Traffic uses the middle lane for emergencies only

correct.text: If you intend to overtake, you must consider that approaching traffic could be planning the same manoeuvre. When you've considered the situation and decided it's safe, indicate your intentions early. This will show the approaching traffic that you intend to pull out.

incorrect.text: If you intend to overtake, you must consider that approaching traffic could be planning the same manoeuvre. When you've considered the situation and decided it's safe, indicate your intentions early. This will show the approaching traffic that you intend to pull out.

config.text: You've been involved in an argument that's made you feel angry. What should you do before starting your journey?

choices.label: Open a window
Turn on your radio
Have an alcoholic drink
Calm down

correct.text: If you're feeling upset or angry, you'll find it much more difficult to concentrate on your driving. You should wait until you've calmed down before starting a journey.

incorrect.text: If you're feeling upset or angry, you'll find it much more difficult to concentrate on your driving. You should wait until you've calmed down before starting a journey.

config.text: Where would it be unsafe to overtake?

choices.label: On a single carriageway
On a one-way street
Approaching a junction
Travelling up a long hill

correct.text: You should overtake only when it's really necessary and you can see it’s clear ahead. Look out for road signs and markings that show it's illegal or would be unsafe to overtake; for example, approaching junctions or bends. In many cases, overtaking is unlikely to significantly improve your journey time.

incorrect.text: You should overtake only when it's really necessary and you can see it’s clear ahead. Look out for road signs and markings that show it's illegal or would be unsafe to overtake; for example, approaching junctions or bends. In many cases, overtaking is unlikely to significantly improve your journey time.

config.text: What does the solid white line at the side of the road indicate?

choices.label: Traffic lights ahead
Edge of the carriageway
Footpath on the left
Cycle path

correct.text: The continuous white line shows the edge of the carriageway. It can be especially useful when visibility is restricted, such as at night or in bad weather. It's discontinued in some places; for example, at junctions, lay-bys, entrances or other openings.

incorrect.text: The continuous white line shows the edge of the carriageway. It can be especially useful when visibility is restricted, such as at night or in bad weather. It's discontinued in some places; for example, at junctions, lay-bys, entrances or other openings.

config.text: What can you do to help prevent tiredness on a long journey?

choices.label: Eat a large meal before driving
Take regular refreshment breaks
Play loud music in the car
Complete the journey without stopping

correct.text: Long-distance driving can be boring. This, coupled with a stuffy, warm vehicle, can make you feel tired and sleepy. Make sure you take rest breaks to help you stay awake and alert. Stop in a safe place before you get to the stage of fighting sleep.

incorrect.text: Long-distance driving can be boring. This, coupled with a stuffy, warm vehicle, can make you feel tired and sleepy. Make sure you take rest breaks to help you stay awake and alert. Stop in a safe place before you get to the stage of fighting sleep.

config.text: What does this signal from a police officer mean to oncoming traffic?

choices.label: Go ahead
Stop
Turn left
Turn right

correct.text: Police officers may need to direct traffic; for example, at a junction where the traffic lights have broken down. Check your copy of The Highway Code for the signals that they use.

incorrect.text: Police officers may need to direct traffic; for example, at a junction where the traffic lights have broken down. Check your copy of The Highway Code for the signals that they use.

config.text: You're behind this cyclist. When the traffic lights change, what should you do?

choices.label: Try to move off before the cyclist
Allow the cyclist time and room
Turn right but give the cyclist room
Tap your horn and drive through first

correct.text: Hold back and allow the cyclist to move off. Some junctions have special areas marked across the front of the traffic lane. These allow cyclists to wait for the lights to change and move off ahead of other traffic.

incorrect.text: Hold back and allow the cyclist to move off. Some junctions have special areas marked across the front of the traffic lane. These allow cyclists to wait for the lights to change and move off ahead of other traffic.

config.text: What's the main hazard the driver of the red car (arrowed) should be aware of?

choices.label: Glare from the sun may affect the driver's vision
The black car may stop suddenly
The bus may move out into the road
Oncoming vehicles will assume the driver is turning right

correct.text: If you can do so safely, give way to buses signalling to move off at bus stops. Try to anticipate the actions of other road users around you. The driver of the red car should be prepared for the bus pulling out. As you approach a bus stop, look to see how many passengers are waiting to board. If the last one has just got on, the bus is likely to move off.

incorrect.text: If you can do so safely, give way to buses signalling to move off at bus stops. Try to anticipate the actions of other road users around you. The driver of the red car should be prepared for the bus pulling out. As you approach a bus stop, look to see how many passengers are waiting to board. If the last one has just got on, the bus is likely to move off.

config.text: You're driving on a one-way street. What should you do if you realise you've taken the wrong route?

choices.label: Reverse out of the road
Turn around in a side road
Continue and find another route
Reverse into a driveway

correct.text: Never reverse or turn your vehicle around in a one-way street. It's illegal and could even cause a collision. If you've taken a wrong turn, carry on along the one-way street and find another route, checking the direction signs as you drive. Stop in a safe place if you need to check a map.

incorrect.text: Never reverse or turn your vehicle around in a one-way street. It's illegal and could even cause a collision. If you've taken a wrong turn, carry on along the one-way street and find another route, checking the direction signs as you drive. Stop in a safe place if you need to check a map.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC r293, KYTS p30

config.text: What should you do if the red lights start flashing as you approach a level crossing?

choices.label: Go over it quickly
Go over it carefully
Stop before the barrier
Switch on your hazard warning lights

correct.text: At level crossings, the red lights flash before and while the barrier is down. At most crossings, an amber light will precede the red lights. You must stop behind the white line unless you've already crossed it when the amber light comes on. Don't be tempted to zigzag around half-barriers.

incorrect.text: At level crossings, the red lights flash before and while the barrier is down. At most crossings, an amber light will precede the red lights. You must stop behind the white line unless you've already crossed it when the amber light comes on. Don't be tempted to zigzag around half-barriers.

meta.xref: DES s10, HC r134, HC p133, KYTS p151

config.text: What might you expect to happen in this situation?

choices.label: Traffic will move into the right-hand lane
Traffic speed will increase
Traffic will move into the left-hand lane
Traffic won't need to change position

correct.text: Be courteous and allow the traffic to merge into the left-hand lane.

incorrect.text: Be courteous and allow the traffic to merge into the left-hand lane.

config.text: You're approaching a crossroads. What should you do if the traffic lights have failed?

choices.label: Brake and stop only for large vehicles
Brake sharply to a stop before looking
Be prepared to brake sharply to a stop
Be prepared to stop for any traffic

correct.text: When approaching a junction where the traffic lights have failed, you should proceed with caution. Treat the situation as an unmarked junction and be prepared to stop.

incorrect.text: When approaching a junction where the traffic lights have failed, you should proceed with caution. Treat the situation as an unmarked junction and be prepared to stop.

config.text: What should you do if you begin to feel drowsy while you're driving?

choices.label: Stop and rest as soon as possible
Turn the heater up to keep you warm and comfortable
Close the car windows to help you concentrate
Continue with your journey but drive more slowly

correct.text: You'll be putting other road users at risk if you continue to drive when you're drowsy. Pull over and stop in a safe place for a rest. If you're driving a long distance, think about finding some accommodation so you can rest for longer before continuing your journey.

incorrect.text: You'll be putting other road users at risk if you continue to drive when you're drowsy. Pull over and stop in a safe place for a rest. If you're driving a long distance, think about finding some accommodation so you can rest for longer before continuing your journey.

meta.xref: DES s1, DES s11, HC r91

config.text: What should you do if you become tired while you're driving on a motorway?

choices.label: Pull up on the hard shoulder and change drivers
Leave the motorway at the next exit and rest
Increase your speed and turn up the radio volume
Close all your windows and set the heating to warm

correct.text: If you feel yourself becoming tired or sleepy, you should leave the motorway at the next exit or services and stop for a rest. If you have to drive a long way, leave earlier and plan your journey to include rest stops. That way, you're less likely to become tired while driving and you'll still arrive in good time.

incorrect.text: If you feel yourself becoming tired or sleepy, you should leave the motorway at the next exit or services and stop for a rest. If you have to drive a long way, leave earlier and plan your journey to include rest stops. That way, you're less likely to become tired while driving and you'll still arrive in good time.

meta.xref: DES s5, DES s10, HC r112

config.text: What should you do if the vehicle starts reversing off the driveway?

choices.label: Move to the opposite side of the road
Drive through as you have priority
Sound your horn and be prepared to stop
Speed up and drive through quickly

correct.text: White lights at the rear of a car show that the driver has selected reverse gear. The driver is hidden from view so can't see you approaching. Sound your horn to warn of your presence, and be ready to stop if the car reverses into your path.

incorrect.text: White lights at the rear of a car show that the driver has selected reverse gear. The driver is hidden from view so can't see you approaching. Sound your horn to warn of your presence, and be ready to stop if the car reverses into your path.

config.text: What's the main hazard shown in this picture?

choices.label: Vehicles turning right
Vehicles doing U-turns
The cyclist crossing the road
Parked cars around the corner

correct.text: Look at the picture carefully and try to imagine you're there. The cyclist in this picture appears to be trying to cross the road. You must be able to deal with the unexpected, especially when you're approaching a hazardous junction. Look well ahead to give yourself time to deal with any hazards.

incorrect.text: Look at the picture carefully and try to imagine you're there. The cyclist in this picture appears to be trying to cross the road. You must be able to deal with the unexpected, especially when you're approaching a hazardous junction. Look well ahead to give yourself time to deal with any hazards.

config.text: Which type of glasses would make driving at night more difficult?

choices.label: Half-moon
Round
Bifocal
Tinted

correct.text: If you're driving at night or in poor visibility, tinted lenses will reduce the efficiency of your vision by reducing the amount of light reaching your eyes.

incorrect.text: If you're driving at night or in poor visibility, tinted lenses will reduce the efficiency of your vision by reducing the amount of light reaching your eyes.

config.text: What type of vehicle displays this yellow sign?

choices.label: A broken-down vehicle
A school bus
An ice-cream van
A private ambulance

correct.text: Buses which carry children to and from school may stop at places other than scheduled bus stops. Be aware that they might pull over at any time to allow children to get on or off. This will normally be when traffic is heavy during rush hour.

incorrect.text: Buses which carry children to and from school may stop at places other than scheduled bus stops. Be aware that they might pull over at any time to allow children to get on or off. This will normally be when traffic is heavy during rush hour.

config.text: What should the driver of the car approaching the crossing do?

choices.label: Continue at the same speed
Sound the horn
Drive through quickly
Slow down and get ready to stop

correct.text: Look well ahead to see whether any hazards are developing. This will give you more time to deal with them in the correct way. The man in the picture is clearly intending to cross the road. You should be travelling at a speed that allows you to check your mirror, slow down and stop in good time. You shouldn't have to brake harshly.

incorrect.text: Look well ahead to see whether any hazards are developing. This will give you more time to deal with them in the correct way. The man in the picture is clearly intending to cross the road. You should be travelling at a speed that allows you to check your mirror, slow down and stop in good time. You shouldn't have to brake harshly.

meta.xref: DES s3, HC r116, HC r276

config.text: When should you use hazard warning lights?

choices.label: When you're double-parked on a two-way road
When your direction indicators aren't working
When warning oncoming traffic that you intend to stop
When your vehicle has broken down and is causing an obstruction

correct.text: Hazard warning lights are an important safety feature and should be used if you've broken down and are causing an obstruction. Don’t use them as an excuse to park illegally. You may also use them on motorways to warn traffic behind you of danger ahead.

incorrect.text: Hazard warning lights are an important safety feature and should be used if you've broken down and are causing an obstruction. Don’t use them as an excuse to park illegally. You may also use them on motorways to warn traffic behind you of danger ahead.

config.text: Which road user has caused a hazard?

choices.label: The parked car (arrowed A)
The pedestrian waiting to cross (arrowed B)
The moving car (arrowed C)
The car turning (arrowed D)

correct.text:
The car arrowed A is parked within the area marked by zigzag lines at the pedestrian crossing. Parking here is illegal. It also
  • blocks the view for pedestrians wishing to cross the road
  • restricts the view of the crossing for approaching traffic.

incorrect.text:
The car arrowed A is parked within the area marked by zigzag lines at the pedestrian crossing. Parking here is illegal. It also
  • blocks the view for pedestrians wishing to cross the road
  • restricts the view of the crossing for approaching traffic.

config.text: What should you do if a driver pulls out of a side road in front of you, causing you to brake hard?

choices.label: Ignore the error and stay calm
Flash your lights to show your annoyance
Sound your horn to show your annoyance
Overtake as soon as possible

correct.text: Be tolerant if a vehicle emerges and you have to brake quickly. Anyone can make a mistake, so don’t react aggressively. Be alert where there are side roads and be especially careful where there are parked vehicles, because these can make it difficult for emerging drivers to see you.

incorrect.text: Be tolerant if a vehicle emerges and you have to brake quickly. Anyone can make a mistake, so don’t react aggressively. Be alert where there are side roads and be especially careful where there are parked vehicles, because these can make it difficult for emerging drivers to see you.

meta.xref: DES s6, HC p133, KYTS p150-151

config.text: You're driving on this dual carriageway. Why may you need to slow down?

choices.label: There's a broken white line in the centre
There are solid white lines on either side
There are roadworks ahead of you
There are no footpaths

correct.text:
Look well ahead and read any road signs as you drive. They're there to inform you of what's ahead. In this case, you may need to slow down and change direction.
Check your mirrors so you know what's happening around you before you change speed or direction.

incorrect.text:
Look well ahead and read any road signs as you drive. They're there to inform you of what's ahead. In this case, you may need to slow down and change direction.
Check your mirrors so you know what's happening around you before you change speed or direction.

meta.xref: DES s11, HC p133, KYTS p157

config.text: You're on a three-lane motorway. How should you overtake a slow-moving lorry in the middle lane if it's showing this sign?

choices.label: Cautiously approach the lorry, then overtake on either side
Follow the lorry until you can leave the motorway
Use the right-hand lane and overtake the lorry normally
Approach with care and overtake on the left of the lorry

correct.text: This sign is found on slow-moving or stationary works vehicles. If you wish to overtake it, do so on the left, as indicated. Be aware that there might be people working in the area.

incorrect.text: This sign is found on slow-moving or stationary works vehicles. If you wish to overtake it, do so on the left, as indicated. Be aware that there might be people working in the area.

config.text: You want to turn left at this junction. What should you do if your view of the main road is restricted?

choices.label: Stay well back and wait to see if anything comes
Build up your speed so that you can emerge quickly
Stop and apply the parking brake even if the road is clear
Approach slowly and edge out until you can see more clearly

correct.text: You should slow right down, and stop if necessary, at any junction where your view is restricted. Edge forward until you can see properly. Only then can you decide whether it's safe to go.

incorrect.text: You should slow right down, and stop if necessary, at any junction where your view is restricted. Edge forward until you can see properly. Only then can you decide whether it's safe to go.

config.text: You've just been overtaken by this motorcyclist. What should you do if the rider cuts in sharply?

choices.label: Sound the horn
Brake firmly
Keep a safe gap
Flash your lights

correct.text: If another vehicle cuts in sharply, ease off the accelerator and drop back to allow a safe separation distance. Try not to overreact by braking sharply or swerving, as you could lose control. If vehicles behind you are too close or unprepared, it could lead to a crash.

incorrect.text: If another vehicle cuts in sharply, ease off the accelerator and drop back to allow a safe separation distance. Try not to overreact by braking sharply or swerving, as you could lose control. If vehicles behind you are too close or unprepared, it could lead to a crash.

config.text: What should you do if you start to feel drowsy while you're driving on a motorway?

choices.label: Stop on the hard shoulder for a sleep
Open a window and stop as soon as it’s safe and legal
Speed up to arrive at your destination sooner
Slow down and let other drivers overtake

correct.text: Never stop on the hard shoulder to rest. If there's no service area for several miles, leave the motorway at the next exit and find somewhere safe and legal to pull over.

incorrect.text: Never stop on the hard shoulder to rest. If there's no service area for several miles, leave the motorway at the next exit and find somewhere safe and legal to pull over.

meta.xref: DES s7, DES s10, HC r205-206

config.text: What should the driver of the grey car be especially aware of?

choices.label: The uneven road surface
Traffic following behind
Doors opening on parked cars
Empty parking spaces

correct.text: When passing parked cars, there's a risk that a driver or passenger may not check before opening the door into the road. A defensive driver will drive slowly and be looking for people who may be about to get out of their car.

incorrect.text: When passing parked cars, there's a risk that a driver or passenger may not check before opening the door into the road. A defensive driver will drive slowly and be looking for people who may be about to get out of their car.

meta.xref: HC r258, HC p122, KYTS p142

config.text: You're driving on a road with several lanes. What do these signs above the lanes mean?

choices.label: The two right lanes are open
The two left lanes are open
Traffic in the left lanes should stop
Traffic in the right lanes should stop

correct.text: On some busy roads, lane control signals are used to vary the number of lanes available to give priority to the main traffic flow. A green arrow indicates that the lane is available to traffic facing the signal. A white diagonal arrow means that the lane is closed ahead and traffic should move to the next lane on the left. A red cross means that the lane is closed to traffic facing the signal.

incorrect.text: On some busy roads, lane control signals are used to vary the number of lanes available to give priority to the main traffic flow. A green arrow indicates that the lane is available to traffic facing the signal. A white diagonal arrow means that the lane is closed ahead and traffic should move to the next lane on the left. A red cross means that the lane is closed to traffic facing the signal.

config.text: What should you do as you approach this cyclist?

choices.label: Try to overtake before the cyclist gets to the junction
Flash your headlights at the cyclist
Slow down and allow the cyclist to turn
Rev your engine so the cyclist knows you're following behind

correct.text: Keep well back and give the cyclist time and room to turn safely. Don’t intimidate them by getting too close or trying to squeeze past.

incorrect.text: Keep well back and give the cyclist time and room to turn safely. Don’t intimidate them by getting too close or trying to squeeze past.

config.text: What must you do if poor health affects your driving?

choices.label: Inform your local police
Avoid using motorways
Always drive accompanied
Inform the licensing authority

correct.text: You must tell DVLA (or DVA in Northern Ireland) if your health is likely to affect your ability to drive. The licensing authority will investigate your situation and then make a decision on whether you're fit enough to drive safely.

incorrect.text: You must tell DVLA (or DVA in Northern Ireland) if your health is likely to affect your ability to drive. The licensing authority will investigate your situation and then make a decision on whether you're fit enough to drive safely.

config.text: Why must you take great care when emerging from this junction?

choices.label: The road surface is poor
The footpath is narrow
The kerbs are high
The view is restricted

correct.text: You may have to pull forward slowly until you can see up and down the road. Be aware that the traffic approaching the junction can’t see you either. If you don’t know that it’s clear, don’t go.

incorrect.text: You may have to pull forward slowly until you can see up and down the road. Be aware that the traffic approaching the junction can’t see you either. If you don’t know that it’s clear, don’t go.

config.text: How does drinking alcohol affect your driving behaviour?

choices.label: It improves judgement skills
It increases confidence
It leads to faster reactions
It increases concentration

correct.text: Alcohol can increase confidence to a point where your driving behaviour might become ‘out of character’. Sensible behaviour might change to risk-taking behaviour. Never let yourself or your friends get into this situation.

incorrect.text: Alcohol can increase confidence to a point where your driving behaviour might become ‘out of character’. Sensible behaviour might change to risk-taking behaviour. Never let yourself or your friends get into this situation.

config.text: What should you do if you think the driver of the vehicle in front has forgotten to cancel their right indicator?

choices.label: Flash your lights to alert the driver
Sound your horn before overtaking
Overtake on the left if there's room
Stay behind and don't overtake

correct.text: Be cautious and don’t attempt to overtake. The driver may be unsure of the location of a junction and may turn suddenly.

incorrect.text: Be cautious and don’t attempt to overtake. The driver may be unsure of the location of a junction and may turn suddenly.

config.text: Where would you expect to see these markers?

choices.label: On a motorway sign
On a railway bridge
On a large goods vehicle
On a diversion sign

correct.text: These markers must be fitted to vehicles over 13 metres long, large goods vehicles, and rubbish skips placed in the road. They're reflective to make them easier to see in the dark.

incorrect.text: These markers must be fitted to vehicles over 13 metres long, large goods vehicles, and rubbish skips placed in the road. They're reflective to make them easier to see in the dark.

config.text: What should you do about driving if you've been taking medicine that causes drowsiness?

choices.label: Only drive if your journey is necessary
Drive on quiet roads
Ask someone to come with you
Avoid driving and check with your doctor

correct.text: You aren't fit to drive if you're taking medicine that makes you drowsy. Check with your doctor if you're unsure. You mustn't put other road users, your passengers or yourself at risk.

incorrect.text: You aren't fit to drive if you're taking medicine that makes you drowsy. Check with your doctor if you're unsure. You mustn't put other road users, your passengers or yourself at risk.

meta.xref: DES s8, HC p128, KYTS p10

config.text: Why should you reduce your speed here?

choices.label: A staggered junction is ahead
A low bridge is ahead
The road surface changes ahead
The road narrows ahead

correct.text: Traffic could be turning off or pulling out ahead of you, to the left or right. Vehicles turning left will be slowing down before the junction, and any vehicles turning right may have to stop to allow oncoming traffic to clear. Be prepared for this, as you might have to slow down or stop behind them.

incorrect.text: Traffic could be turning off or pulling out ahead of you, to the left or right. Vehicles turning left will be slowing down before the junction, and any vehicles turning right may have to stop to allow oncoming traffic to clear. Be prepared for this, as you might have to slow down or stop behind them.

config.text: You take some cough medicine given to you by a friend. What should you do before driving your car?

choices.label: Ask your friend if taking the medicine affected their driving
Drink some strong coffee one hour before driving
Check the label to see if the medicine will affect your driving
Drive a short distance to see if the medicine is affecting your driving

correct.text: If you've taken medicine, never drive without first checking what the side effects might be; they might affect your judgement and perception, and therefore endanger lives.

incorrect.text: If you've taken medicine, never drive without first checking what the side effects might be; they might affect your judgement and perception, and therefore endanger lives.

config.text: What should you do if the traffic in the left-hand lane is slowing?

choices.label: Slow down, keeping a safe separation distance
Accelerate past the vehicles in the left-hand lane
Pull up on the left-hand verge
Move across and continue in the right-hand lane

correct.text: Allow the traffic to merge into the left-hand lane. Leave enough room so that you can maintain a safe separation distance, even if vehicles pull in ahead of you.

incorrect.text: Allow the traffic to merge into the left-hand lane. Leave enough room so that you can maintain a safe separation distance, even if vehicles pull in ahead of you.

config.text: How can drinking alcohol affect your ability to drive or ride?

choices.label: Your ability to judge speed will be reduced
Your confidence will be reduced
Your reactions will be faster
Your awareness of danger will be improved

correct.text:
Alcohol will severely reduce your ability to drive or ride safely and there are serious consequences if you’re caught over the drink-drive limit. It's known that alcohol can
  • affect your judgement
  • cause overconfidence
  • reduce coordination and control.

incorrect.text:
Alcohol will severely reduce your ability to drive or ride safely and there are serious consequences if you’re caught over the drink-drive limit. It's known that alcohol can
  • affect your judgement
  • cause overconfidence
  • reduce coordination and control.

config.text: What's the main hazard you should be aware of when following this cyclist?

choices.label: The cyclist may move to the left and dismount
The cyclist may swerve into the road
The cyclist may get off and push their bicycle
The cyclist may wish to turn right at the end of the road

correct.text: When following a cyclist, be aware that they have to deal with the hazards around them. They may wobble or swerve to avoid a pothole in the road or see a potential hazard and change direction suddenly. Don’t follow them too closely or rev your engine impatiently.

incorrect.text: When following a cyclist, be aware that they have to deal with the hazards around them. They may wobble or swerve to avoid a pothole in the road or see a potential hazard and change direction suddenly. Don’t follow them too closely or rev your engine impatiently.

meta.xref: DES s3, HC r116, HC r276

config.text: When may you use hazard warning lights?

choices.label: When driving on a motorway to warn traffic behind of a hazard ahead
When you're double-parked on a two-way road
When your direction indicators aren't working
When warning oncoming traffic that you intend to stop

correct.text:
Hazard warning lights are an important safety feature. Use them when driving on a motorway to warn traffic behind you of danger ahead.
You should also use them if your vehicle has broken down and is causing an obstruction.

incorrect.text:
Hazard warning lights are an important safety feature. Use them when driving on a motorway to warn traffic behind you of danger ahead.
You should also use them if your vehicle has broken down and is causing an obstruction.

config.text: How should you drive or ride in areas with traffic-calming measures?

choices.label: At a reduced speed
At the speed limit
In the centre of the road
With headlights on dipped beam

correct.text: Traffic-calming measures such as road humps, chicanes and narrowings are intended to slow traffic down to protect vulnerable road users. Don't speed up until you reach the end of the traffic-calmed zone.

incorrect.text: Traffic-calming measures such as road humps, chicanes and narrowings are intended to slow traffic down to protect vulnerable road users. Don't speed up until you reach the end of the traffic-calmed zone.

config.text: What should you do as you approach this overhead bridge?

choices.label: Move out to the centre of the road before going through
Find another route; this one is only for high vehicles
Be prepared to give way to large vehicles in the middle of the road
Move across to the right-hand side before going through

correct.text: Oncoming large vehicles may need to move to the middle of the road to pass safely under the bridge. There won't be enough room for you to continue, so you should be ready to stop and wait.

incorrect.text: Oncoming large vehicles may need to move to the middle of the road to pass safely under the bridge. There won't be enough room for you to continue, so you should be ready to stop and wait.

config.text: What must you do if your ability to drive is impaired during a period of illness?

choices.label: See your doctor each time before you drive
Take smaller doses of any medicines
Stop driving until you're fit to drive again
Take all your medicines with you when you drive

correct.text: Only drive if you're fit to do so. Driving when you're ill or taking some medicines can affect your concentration and judgement. It may also cause you to become drowsy or even fall asleep.

incorrect.text: Only drive if you're fit to do so. Driving when you're ill or taking some medicines can affect your concentration and judgement. It may also cause you to become drowsy or even fall asleep.

config.text: What will become more expensive after you've been convicted of driving while unfit through drink or drugs?

choices.label: Road fund licence
Insurance premiums
Vehicle test certificate
Driving licence

correct.text: You've shown that you're a risk to yourself and others on the road. For this reason, insurance companies may charge you a higher premium.

incorrect.text: You've shown that you're a risk to yourself and others on the road. For this reason, insurance companies may charge you a higher premium.

config.text: Why are vehicle mirrors often slightly curved (convex)?

choices.label: They give a wider field of vision
They totally cover blind spots
They make it easier to judge the speed of the traffic behind
They make the traffic behind look bigger

correct.text: Although a convex mirror gives a wide view of the scene behind, you should be aware that it won't show you everything behind or to the side of your vehicle. Before you move off, you'll need to look over your shoulder to check for anything not visible in the mirrors.

incorrect.text: Although a convex mirror gives a wide view of the scene behind, you should be aware that it won't show you everything behind or to the side of your vehicle. Before you move off, you'll need to look over your shoulder to check for anything not visible in the mirrors.

config.text: You need glasses to read a vehicle number plate at the required distance. When must you wear them?

choices.label: Only in bad weather conditions
Whenever you're driving
When you think it's necessary
Only at night time

correct.text: Have your eyesight tested before you start your practical training. Then, throughout your driving life, have checks periodically, as your vision may change.

incorrect.text: Have your eyesight tested before you start your practical training. Then, throughout your driving life, have checks periodically, as your vision may change.

config.text: You're following a slower-moving vehicle. What should you do if there's a junction just ahead on the right?

choices.label: Overtake after checking your mirrors and signalling
Only consider overtaking when you're past the junction
Accelerate quickly to overtake before reaching the junction
Slow down and prepare to overtake on the left

correct.text: You should never overtake as you approach a junction. If a vehicle emerged from the junction while you were overtaking, a dangerous situation could develop very quickly.

incorrect.text: You should never overtake as you approach a junction. If a vehicle emerged from the junction while you were overtaking, a dangerous situation could develop very quickly.

guide_to_riding.title: The Official DVSA Guide to Riding - the essential skills
